website_summaries.verdict: This non-programmable calculator is ideal for situations when graphing is not allowed.
pros: Built to last and very durable with a plethora of functions
This solar-powered calculator keeps its charge well, though it also features backup battery power
Easy to learn and fast to use
cons: Users report some keys are hard to read, affecting usability

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect calculations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator to use in chemistry class and loved it at first. But then I noticed that my calculations were not as accurate as my professor's who was doing his calculations through his iPhone. Turns out the TI-36X Pro has a few bugs that cause it to give out incorrect calculations. If you're a student using this calculator for a test, your teacher might mark some of your answers incorrect. You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Silver keys are not readable
customer_reviews.text: The picture must have been altered, because the unit I received had illegible and gaudy silver coated keys on the right of the keypad - - ÷\x\+\-. These keys were illegible under almost any lighting and not representative of how they were shown in the photo. I am not happy about having to pay return fees on this.
customer_reviews.author: Baudelaire

customer_reviews.title: Garbage screen from the 60's makes this impossible to use.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a TI Nspire CX CAS, this 36x-pro is garbage. It isn't intuitive like the Nspire is, nor does it allow you to re-use equations from earlier. There is no way to recall a previous answer and the screen is HORRIBLE, only 2 lines of text, seriously?! The original 84 had a better screen than this thing! I spent hours on youtube watching videos to learn how to manipulate this calculator, but alas, it is a pile of garbage IMO. I hate that people had to ruin the FE exam forcing them to ban all "advanced" calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The layout is extremely difficult to get used to. However, the single most annoying thoughtless amateur thing about this calculator is the fact that they chose to use silver on silver for the primary operations buttons (addition, subtraction, etc...). This is IMPOSSIBLE to see in ANY lighting. You have to play with the angle of the calculator to make sure you are seeing and choosing the right button. Why would one of the leaders in calculators do something so completely WRONG?? Trust me this WILL annoy you. Skip this and find something with buttons that are clearly visible and with a layout that lets you work quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: reVizion

customer_reviews.title: Lucky it didn't break during a test
customer_reviews.text: I've only haha this for two weeks and it stopped working. The buttons don't respond consistently. After a hard reset it works only long enough to trips in 3 or 4 numbers and then stopped responding again. Never had a problem like this with a TI calculator but this is unusable. I'm glad it broke will I was doing homework and not during a test.
customer_reviews.author: Kara L.

customer_reviews.title: One of my greatest purchases
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize I bought this back in 2014. This calculator has been with me ever since then. I picked it up as a cheaper alternative to the TI 84, which I no longer needed in college as a biology major. This saw 4 years of undergrad courses, the GRE, and daily use in my job. It's a great calculator with basic functionality that mirrored the keypad layout of the Ti 84 which I was used to growing up. The only thing I 'dislike' is, working in a lab all day, I will have to bring my calculator outside once every 3 months to charge. I guess the fluorescent lighting doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Yes

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the TI datasheet fool you... The TI-36X Pro is more powerful than the datasheet leads one to believe--it is marketed toward education only. Its usefulness as a scientific/engineering calculator goes way beyond education, and the machine will continue to be useful on the job. It is easy to learn and there are plenty of "how to use a scientific calculator" papers and books available online to help. If you can't afford a graphing calculator or can't use one for some reason, and you need a scientific model, but don't need programming, get the TI-36X Pro. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: GaryA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but small gripes
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice calculator. It shows things just like on paper when you enter fractions, it solves for variables, solves second and third degree polynomials, does systems of equations and even though it can't graph makes tables of data out of functions. It also has some constants and unit conversions to choose from. The number solver could use more memory though as it can not solve for some equations it also does not do calculus with degrees properly as it gives incorrect answer!!(I checked the mode). The display could also be brighter at certain angles. Otherwise for $20 this almost rivals a ti 84...without being programmmable or being able to graph of course
customer_reviews.author: Ajani Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Great for students.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son’s middle school math class. It was well priced and he says it has all the functions he needs plus some. It’s got a nice hard case to keep it safe in his backpack. We’ve been very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Good for school and work (Engineer)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this way back in freshman year of college when someone stole my Casio scientific calculator. Screw that guy. Glad he stole it though, because this thing is so easy to use, so bombproof, and has all the features you could need, short of a graphing calculator. This is about as good as scientific calculators get. I still use it daily at work as an engineer. You won't regret your purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: Everything I always wanted in a calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for any STEM student or professional who wants a reasonably powerful pocket calculator but doesn't need graphing capabilities. I'm a junior undergraduate student majoring in math, and this is the calculator I've always wanted but never knew about until recently. It's just about everything you would get from any other Texas Instrument model minus graphing capabilities, which is exactly what I need since any graphing I do is done on a computer anyway. Obviously don't get this if you're taking a course that requires a graphing calculator. Otherwise, this is probably the best (and certainly best value) TI model out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ashby Gray

customer_reviews.title: Math class and beyond!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for a math class that needed a scientific calculator. It looks professional and works well. It has a ton of features, so it’s a bit complicated for the advanced stuff at first. But it can be basic too. I think this is good because it will grow with the student as the work gets complicated. The packaging was great and it came well secured. I am happy we got one with advanced features even though it might seem complicated, I won’t have to keep rebuying! Fast, prime delivery too!
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing calculator
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how useful this calculator is! I'm taking two graduate engineering courses and this calculator was recommended by the professor. I'm so glad I bought it. It makes it SO EASY to solve polynomials, quadratics, and even integrals!! Highly recommended. I still don't know how to use all the functions of this little number cruncher, but it has served me well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jack of all Trades and Master of Some
customer_reviews.text: This has been a wonderful tool in Business statistic especially for chi squared operations. I'm not allowed to use a graphing calculator so it's super helpful. Although I wish or maybe I haven't figured it out yet, but being able to dobpartial derivatives would be nice. Derivatives and integral solving option is nice but for partial derivatives this would be perfect. I'm still giving a 5 star because I don't really use partial derivatives all that much and it's great for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: AMC Supreme

customer_reviews.title: So useful it almost feels like cheating
customer_reviews.text: I got this calculator for a math class that banned graphing calculators. My graphing calculator was from the same brand so I wanted something with a similar set up to that. What I didn't know is this calculator handles fractions like a champ, I'm not the best with fractions so being able to double check my work and get the simplified forms has been an absolute blessing. I personally don't mind the metallic buttons which really feels like the only con, it's worth the extra dollars spent.
customer_reviews.author: Average Jill

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it’s me, or the calculators I have used in the past years, but I am so used to the plus button being right above the equal button. This calculator has a function button above the equal button. When I would need to add quickly, I would naturally click the function button as I am so used to the plus button being right above the equal button. It was slowing me down, and was extremely frustrating. The display is also small, so you can’t see a great amount of the previous numbers. I feel this calculator is okay for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RS2020

customer_reviews.title: GREAT replacement for graphing calculator
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a calculator to replace your graphing calculator for an exam or class get this!!! It has all the constants preprogrammed in it, can solve trigonometric functions, and can convert units such as temp and energy. Seriously makes chemistry a breeze! Can’t recommend it more. I had a TI-84 + CE and this is the perfect replacement for it.
customer_reviews.author: Carigan

customer_reviews.title: Great basic scientific calculator for Intro to Stats
customer_reviews.text: Great basic scientific calculator for Intro to Stats. I like that it can display fractions as "over-under," for ease in typing in work, and that it has other "MathPrint" features like integrals, exponents, etc. You can input data into a list and the calculator will compute summary statistics, and it also does regression and distributions (normal, inverse normal, binomial, Poisson). The only thing this calculator is missing from our stats course is the ability to check confidence intervals and hypothesis testing (our class does the work by hand and using tables, so this works for us, but wouldn't work if your calculator is supposed to do all those computations for you).
customer_reviews.author: Kat W.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mechanical engineer and need a calculator to have handy on my desk for quick calculations. My old TI-89 from my college days finally bit the dust and I needed a replacement. My PC handles all the calcs that require significant horsepower, so I was looking for something simpler and cheaper. I wanted something reliable and with the ability to scroll back through past calculations. This calculator does exactly that. My only complaint is that some of the keys have a chrome colored finish with an indent of the function/command. These can be difficult to read under certain lighting conditions and I would have preferred a standard finish such as the other keys have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Texas Instruments never fails
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps my favorite calculator yet. The buttons are much better than other calculators in the aspect of build quality. The amount of functionality put into this small calculator is very useful especially for those in engineering. I've seen some people in the comments/review section complain about the readability of the shiny buttons; however, despite it being true to some degree, once you use the calculator frequently, you will be able to press the desired buttons (shiny as buttons included) without having to look at each button you press. Otherwise, this calculator is great!
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Defected product& have to request a replacement
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as defected. The buttons are hard to press and sometimes don’t respond. So I’ve to request a replacement. Overall, I like it, particularly it can find the derivative and solve the integral that other scientific calculator can’t. I already have a ti-84 and a ti-89. The only reason I buy it is because my professor only allowed us to use scientific calculator for the exam. So I’ve to turn to this one.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: You will have to learn to use parentheses to make it work properly.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - Algebraic entry flaws. // Astonished that simple algebraic entries return incorrect answers. -3^4 returns -81 rather than 81 unless you use brackets to force the calculator to recognize three as negative : (-3)^4 yields 81. // So frustrating to have to explain these product flaws to 8th Grade Algebra students! // Just sad...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Herdlick

customer_reviews.title: Best Scientific Calculator for the Money, Maybe Any Money.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot sing the praises of this calculator enough. I teach high school science and this is just the best calculator I've ever used with students. It is easy to learn and use. It has all the best chemistry/physics constants preprogrammed into it too! It is very reasonably priced and allowed for use on the ACT. Whenever a student asks what kind of calculator to get, I never hesitate to say this one. I have more expensive calculators but this is the only one I use any more.
customer_reviews.author: K.Cook

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device at awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price and easy to figure out. I've always been a TI user, which helps. Look on youtube for simple instructional videos on how to use certain features. I needed a calculator that is approved for use on the Fundamentals of Engineering and Professional Engineering exams, which my TI-83 is not. This calculator does everything the TI-83 does short of graphing, which I've not needed to do since high school anyway. I mainly needed this for complex number conversions and arithmetic to speed up test taking in college and for preps for the aforementioned exams I plan to take.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was used to
customer_reviews.text: What a racket. Was required to get this for one of my exams and there’s an extra button where the plus function should be. Wasn’t how I was raised. I can’t tell you how many times I hit that symbol instead of what I was intending to... causing me to lose valuable time during my exam. I should have paid closer attention and gotten a calculators I was familiar with.... but I didn’t know that they would mess with something so standard.
customer_reviews.author: JJ_KLM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Non Graphing Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Excellent calculator for the Mech. FE or classes that do not allow graphing calculators. Easy to use and easy to read. Can do almost everything my TI-89 can do except graphing and super long expression problems. I still use it in graduate school. It's nice that you can see the problem fully typed on the calculator to make sure you did not make a mistake inputting the information.
customer_reviews.author: Heraldo

customer_reviews.title: I love this calculator
customer_reviews.text: I love this calculator. It replaced a 1992-vintage TI-36 which I used in high school and also loved. This calculator blows that one away, with a 4-line display and display memory, MathPrint, statistical functions, data tables, the ability to intelligently display fractions, to give answers with radicals and correctly simplify expressions, not to mention numerical derivatives and integrals. And, unlike TI's graphing models, it does not bury functions I use frequently in menus. My only minor complaint is about the snap-on cover, which I find much less convenient than the older models' slide-on covers. Still, this is by far the best calculator I've seen for those who don't want or need graphing functionality.
customer_reviews.author: The Latinist

customer_reviews.title: This calculator is the bees knees
customer_reviews.text: Favorite aspect: shows all of your previous steps in your calculations (both input and output; not just output) Least favorite aspect: The cover is clipped on (no slide action) Overall opinion: My second favorite calculator behind the TI-84 (which I can't use on exams because its a programmable calculator, but this one here is a perfect alternative that I can use on exams :] ) It's also pretty aesthetic with its silver buttons and bright light blue wording. Buy it! Trust me, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: excellent FE approved calculator a must for ME's
customer_reviews.text: I was using an HP last semester in statics and previously an unapproved ti86 that finally died after 12 yrs! In dynamics this semester I was suggested to get a ti36x pro because of how user friendly it is. They weren't lying! Integration, derivatives, even quadratic formula have all been done with ease on this. I haven't discovered all the useful features yet but I've only had it two weeks and I'm kicking myself for not getting it sooner. Came with the case/cover that I was afraid I wouldn't get by using this vendor, but I got it in the same packaging as the one in the campus store but for a few bucks cheaper. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old son to use for home school. He won't be needing all the functions yet but I figured it was something he could grow with. It is extremely lightweight and fits comfortably in my son's hand. I really like that it's solar. We go through so many batteries in a month so having a device that doesn't require batteries is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: SYR

customer_reviews.title: Switched over from TI-30XIIS - best decision ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this calculator. A scientific calculator is required for my classes so I've been using the, but I much prefer the weight and feel of my(not allowed in my classes). This is the perfect compromise between the two - absolutely love it, and it has many more advanced features than my TI30. The constants and units section has been invaluable, and the ability to copy and paste saves me TONS of time. I highly recommend this calculator to all science majors who aren't allowed to use graphing calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad one :(
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Didn’t work. Kept giving the wrong answers. Tried to reset and still didn’t work. I’m sure I just got a faulty one or maybe it sat in the hot sun or something but my son needed it for his trig class. His teacher even tried it out and finally just gave him his calculator to use until we got him a new one. Kinda bummed but like I said probably just the one I got.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Hard to see some of the keys
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, of course. I wish more calculators had a backlight feature. This one, as most others, doesn't. My main complaint is the chrome keys. They are embossed with symbols and they are not easy to see. I guess I can try to use some black enamel and paint the keys to make them easier to seel. I use the fraction display frequently for conversions of odd values. It works fine for my other electronics calculations.
customer_reviews.author: Waynemia

customer_reviews.title: The one that I received had chrome buttons on right side that are difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: The TI-36X Pro that I received does not look the same as the picture on Amazon. The difference is the one that I have has chrome buttons on the right side and no ink on those buttons. It is extremely difficult to see the + - / x = and Enter buttons. If the calculator had gray buttons with black ink like the photos then I would give it 5 stars. Hopefully the new version matches the photo on Amazon and those buttons are easy to read. I am attaching a photo of the one that I received with the difficult to read chrome buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to having a full on TI graphing calculator ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two, one for home and one for work. A great alternative to having a full on TI graphing calculator all the time. Same familiar interface but without graphing/programming, honestly neither of which I need in my professional life. I have much better tools for that on my computer. Solar, do need to worry about batteries. Simply put, it's much easier to hammer out some quick calculations on a physical calculator rather than click around in an app.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Thysell

customer_reviews.title: Great simple engineering calculator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for engineering schoolwork. I used it for the first time on a quiz, straight out of the box. That probably wasn’t smart, but I quickly found the buttons I needed. That being said, this calculator is easy to use and the cheapest price I found was on amazon. I also like that it is solar instead of requiring batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Easily my favorite scientific calculator I have tried so far
customer_reviews.text: Easily my favorite scientific calculator I have tried so far. Generally, I use the TI 89 on exams, but some classes won't let you use a graphing calculator. Compared it to other offerings, including a Casio I picked up at Walgreens. The only part I don't like is that the cursor defaults to "replace" instead of "insert." My TI-89 defaults to "insert," which is far preferable. You can switch to "insert" mode, but it frequently reverts back to replace. If there was a way to swap the cursor to "insert" permanently, it'd be my favorite calculator, even better than my TI 89.
customer_reviews.author: Interesting Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in chemistry and physics courses. It's very affordable, easy to use and so far is appropriate to use for my needs. The only thing drawback to this model is the chrome colored keys are kind of difficult to see the symbols unless the light hits them just right. It's not a huge deal, you just have to pay close attention to which key to push.
customer_reviews.author: Megajen

customer_reviews.title: Statistics Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good college level calculator with decent functionality and a cheap price. This calculator was a perfect fit for me. It works great in my relatively simple statistics class. I don't know if it would hold up to the rigors of an advanced mathematics course but it saved me from breaking the bank on a fancy calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY AN IDIOT COULD USE IT
customer_reviews.text: After many years away from math, I was terrified of the logarithms in my hearing science class but this calculator made it a BREEZE. Plenty of videos online to teach you how to use it and best part is that I was able to "type" in the entire problem, making working through problem sets SO much faster! This calculator gave me soooo much confidence with each exam. It is basically my best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Mila Aguila

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I typically use a TI-89 but won't be able to use it for certain exams at school. Ordered this one for those exams and found it super easy to learn and make the transition to. Best part is the solver function which is not available on Casio models of the same degree. Only complaint is that the operator keys (+,-,*,/,etc.) are very shiny and can be hard to see in certain lights. After using it for a while you tend to remember which is which and won't need the visual indicators as much, however.
customer_reviews.author: Ro Havens

customer_reviews.title: Best ABET approved calculator you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best calculators I've ever owned and much cheaper than a graphing calculator. This will do everything you want it to and more, very efficiently. If you are an engineering student this calculator is ABET approved and by far the best approved calculator on their list. Do not try and save $10 by getting the Ti-30. You will regret it. My only complaint is the screen is a bit small and scrolling through it is not optimized but that's an issue with all of these ABET approved calculators so what an engineering student to do??
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I got this and the Casio FX-911 ES PLUS at the same time. They are both great and helped me a lot with math classed, this one is bulkier than the Casio and feels pretty big in your hands, that was the only thing I don't like about it but it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JayCee

customer_reviews.title: New button placement makes it difficult
customer_reviews.text: For most calculators, the right bottom button is equals button; above which is add, subtract, multiply, and divide. This calculator has a function button above the equals, and if you're going for speed during test taking like me, this unconventional setup really messes you up. And to make matters worst, these main buttons are silver with no painted symbols, just indention. It makes it difficult to see if you are pressing multiply or divide. I bought the TI-30XIIS, which has none of these drawbacks. As for the TI-36X Pro, maybe you can get use to the button locations, and it has more features than the TI-30IIS which maybe you need. Best wishes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Almost ideal.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to calculator for just about everything. It has everything I need. Every function is easily accessible. No need to reference a manual as the functions are pretty self evident as to how to use them. I love the 7 memory locations and that you can recall them as variables or the value in the variable. The only thing I'd change are those silver keys for the basic operators. Very hard to see. A solid color key with a contrasting symbol would be so much better.
customer_reviews.author: 🤓

customer_reviews.title: One of the most capable scientific calculators I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Feels like using a ti-84 family calculator, but without the ability to graph, or program anything into the calculator. Regardless, it does a lot of things that are extremely helpful, like definite integrals (though it does take some time to solve more involved ones), and it is better than my ti-nspire cx at simplifying fractions right away. This is probably the most capable scientific calculator I've ever used, and I'd recommend getting one. It has served me well for College level calculus.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney Bologna

customer_reviews.title: Can't Believe It's Solar
customer_reviews.text: Once upon a time, there was a calculator known as the TI-82. It had a new menu system that allowed you to select multiple functions and move between (essentially) tabs. This simple inexpensive scientific calculator now uses that menu system - wild. Also does integrals and derivatives (numerically, not symbolically), and pretty much all of the existing features that you've come to expect from a TI-36 series calculator. Many reviews focused on the fact that a few functions are harder to get to, this is true of those functions, but in general you are getting a more powerful calculator out of the deal. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Hemsath

customer_reviews.title: Operation keys unreadable
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the box, attempted a simple operation (like '+'), immediately realizing that I couldn't read the silver operation keys. For eyes that have difficulty with contrast (like mine), all of the BRIGHT silver operation keys look EXACTLY the same. I had to dim the lights and hold the unit at a angle that made it possible for me to make out the depressions (also the same color...BRIGHT silver). Clearly this unit was not tested with many less than perfect eyes. I'm returning the unit. It is unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Ratzlaff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my medical school coursework. Used a TI-nSPIRE CX CAS in undergrad. I've found a simpler calculator more appropriate for medical school—surprisingly, it's faster to do very simple calculations on this calculator (fewer button presses). I also like not having to worry about the battery. In hindsight, this calculator is probably the only thing you need for college through your career. It has a good number of advanced functions.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Richards

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this calculator.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my favorite calculator for nearly a decade now. I haven’t touched my TI89 since I got this. It can perform a lot of more difficult calculations. But most importantly, it lets you copy your results and add them to a different calculation which saves a ton of time on longer problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Should be the bare minimum calculator for college.
customer_reviews.text: If you're not going to purchasing a graphing calculator, get one in this class. I purchased it for a stats class and it even has built-in stats functions! The alternate viewing mode, mathprint is cool, but I often find it working in relatively innocuous cases when I don't want it to. You can swap answers to the regular notation easily, or even turn mathprint off entirely, but I find it's automatic implementation a little puzzling sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Manly

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love the basic integrating and algebra functions on this device. The feature I can't live with out is being able to scroll up to past lines like on a TI84+ or TI89. Two gripes: 1) navigation buttons are on a one-piece directional pad that is too small to quickly scroll with (TI84 did it better) and 2) moving the cursor up to old entries is great but I have to scroll all the way back down in order to type something new, can't hit escape like my old TI84 to get to new line.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great price & delivery for this Calculator!!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for my College Math Courses!! Plus it's what's allowed while I'm taking tests. For the price, & not having to drive store to store looking for the best price - this calculator is great!! Delivered promptly, and right on time for my Class. Highly recommend this if your looking for a "Safe" calculator to use in any College Math Class!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy A

customer_reviews.title: Good PE exam-approved calculator
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator that is approved to use for the PE exam. My only complaint (and I noticed some other reviews mentioned this) is that the plus, minus, divide, and multiply buttons are all really shiny, and it's kind of hard to see what button you're pressing. This is especially true when I was typing something quickly and would hit the multiply button instead of plus. Other than that, it's just what I needed, but the shiny buttons definitely slowed me down a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic calculator
customer_reviews.text: Good basic calculator if you have undergrad entry level college courses. This calculator is approved for most basic math classes, and has all the functions that will get you through them. I bought a new one just so I can use it for my basic economics class at WGU.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This calculator uses an easy to read format when typing out complex expressions. I’m an engineering major, and this is the only calculator I have found on the approved calculator list for the professional engineering exams that does integration and derivatives. It also has the polynomial solver (up to third degree polynomials) as well as basic matrix functions. This calculator will save you a lot of time, and as stated before, is still allowed on major engineering exams.
customer_reviews.author: Yankees27

customer_reviews.title: Product pictures are very misleading
customer_reviews.text: The product pictures are very misleading. The images make the screen look more like an e-ink. However, it is poorly lit and difficult to read in lower light. I bought this when I went back to school to get a degree. I'm giving this one to my 15yo son and I'm selecting another one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Much Better than TI 30X
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my professional engineering exam and am glad I did. The calculator is smarter and more intuitive than the other exam-approved TI-30X I already owned. I'll likely never use it again now that I passed my exam, but it was still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great features and power!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a "scientific" calculator for chemistry class (not a graphing calculator!) but I wanted something that was easier to copy+paste data/equations. This calculator is pretty powerful for the price and size, while still not being a graphing calculator. I can see multiple lines of equations and copy+paste with ease.
customer_reviews.author: 4jsloveoc

customer_reviews.title: Good "everyday" calculator
customer_reviews.text: While with the age of smartphones made needs for dedicated calculator is not as important as it used to be, I still wanted to get a calculator that's inexpensive yet feature rich enough to stash in my bag. At around $20, it is inexpensive enough, and also supports features I would find useful, like base (HEX/BIN) calculation as well as all the functions I would expect from Scientific calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Hideki Saito

customer_reviews.title: The Best Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best scientific calculator any student should have. Compared to other scientific calculators, this one offers more functions - like derivatives and integrals, while still being around $20. In addition, the overall quality of this calculator surpasses competitors - harder plastic and a click on protector rather than a slide on protector. Another positive of this calculator is that it show more computation lines, so it is easier to keep up with related computations, and it’s history feature allows you to see past computations unless deliberately cleared.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: great power for less $
customer_reviews.text: Perfect calc for that student between high school excellence in advance math class and never going to be a math major. At less than $20, this calc has most things the average math student needs with out the expense of going true graphic calc at $100. I've been a math teacher for 20 yrs and love the versatility of the moderate priced option. If you student wants too go into college advanced calculus, go for the expensive one. Otherwise this will do. (There is an Android baseed app that can do the graphing part! So i use the two together if I really need to graph. )
customer_reviews.author: C.A.M. in U.S.A

customer_reviews.title: Covers the bases
customer_reviews.text: My only application is for quick conversion and manipulation of of dec/hex/octal/binary and the data input of the TI-36X is pretty straight forward. As with most calculators, the key layout and operation takes a little experimentation and practice to become familiar. Seems like a good basic and inexpensive calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Steve_in_St_Louis

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this calculator for ASP and CSP exams. Calculator was great, and did everything that I needed it to. I highly recommend this product. Action on the buttons was great and I did not find the chrome buttons annoying. The large display showed all of my work. Especially enjoy the statistics functionality. There are many tutorial videos on YouTube. I found this calculator intuitive to use and picked it up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark123

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son to use in High School Geometry. The reason why I picked this was that it could display fractions not in decimal form. This was something I felt important. He said that it was easy to use and figure out without using the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Gold3nMan

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, however the quality control department could focus a bit more on "quality!" The right arrow button of the calculator is randomly unresponsive - quite frustrating while taking tests. However, its easy to learn, straight forward and has great features. For the price, I've accepted it's faults.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Confusing?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a relative who was studying advanced Algebra and Trig. What I found is that her textbook told her to enter data into the calculator one way, the Apple Calculator app worked a second way and this calculator worked a third way and IMO, frequently illogically. I had to make her a giant chart to translate between methods.
customer_reviews.author: ZoetMB

customer_reviews.title: Invest in a calculator
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking a pre calculus course and my teacher doesn't allow graphing calculators. This is a god sent because for the 4 lines. I'm able to see my equations, just in case I made a mistake. The table is awesome for using using sine, cosine, and tan.
customer_reviews.author: J.Gomez

customer_reviews.title: My default Calculator for Graduate Studies
customer_reviews.text: Its not as heavy duty as the TI-83 but it comes close second although there is less functionality (graphing). I purchased this calculator for graduate Statistics and Microeconomics and there isn't anything I've needed to do that couldn't be done with this. I like that it is lighter and more compact than my TI-83. It comes with handy instructions and an additional sheet of directions on the back of the cover. Please see the images below for sizing reference and what is included in with the calculator. Overall, I recommend this calculator as a cheaper and more portable alternative to a TI-83
customer_reviews.author: DiscoLemonade

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: College is really hard with this calculator makes it a little easier. It’s super easy to read and the buttons are pretty much self-explanatory. Are use it on tests and really whenever I need it. Right now I’m taking college algebra 120 and I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan k.

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good one
customer_reviews.text: I recently took a class where the teacher told me I'd be denied the use of my trusty-rusty TI-84 and would have to use a non-programmable calculator. This is a pretty good one, and has a solver but, unfortunately, there's a limit to the size of the equation you can enter and many of the problems are too big to fit. But this is still probably the best non-programmable calculator you can get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frank Parnell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Caluculator
customer_reviews.text: I was frustrated to need to buy this for a class because I already own a lot of calculators, but I now like this more than my other scientific calculator(which was cheaper). I like the num-solve command that finds x in a complicated equation like an equilibrium equation without requiring algebra on your part. it really is a nice calculator and I recommend it for a scientific calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Sm 620

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator for the money! It is a bit slow on large integrals, but for the money I cant complain. It has many built in scientific and engineering constants, which is very helpful for physics and engineering calculations. It will also do up to 3x3 matrix calculations, which is very nice for doing vector calculations. This calculator is very easy to use and works great so far. I would strongly recomend this for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: (0-1), not -1
customer_reviews.text: + >Has alot of features. >Layout is easy to get used to. >Replaced another Ti-36x pro that finally died due to extreme negligence/abuse. - >No illuminated screen. It's dim. >Screen is a dust magnet. >Doesn't play Doom.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTurboExtraGnarly

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator compared to the rest of the scientific calculator line up
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator solid build no batteries to replace and has many useful functions for college classes takes a beating and keeps working. My only complaint is that some of the buttons have a chrome finish on them which will eventually wear off. They should have just put a matte plastic over every button. Great device especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eman Hammad

customer_reviews.title: It's like the most capable calculator that is allowed
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the allowed calculators for the FE exam. It's like the most capable calculator that is allowed. It's also the only calculator we are allowed to use in school. It took a while to get used to, but I actually kind of love it now. I watched a few youtube tutorials to figure out all the tricks. It small and the ease of use is great. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: I've got 4 of them...
customer_reviews.text: Chemistry student here; this calculator has been my go-to for 4 years. Keep on in my desk, one in my car, one in my lab coat, and one in my backpack. Really. They've been with me through 3 calculus classes, ODEs, both calc based physics, analytical & quantum chem, the list goes on. IT HAS all constants for chemistry pre-loaded! Can convert between Celsius, kelvin, metric, whatever so you don't have to run look stuff up. Really nice for calculating statistics of anything!!! It was way faster to use for calculating standard deviation than a graphing calculator or by hand. Plus, it's $18. Dunking it accidentally in an acid bath won't set you back a small fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator. It helped me fail my exam like ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent calculator. It helped me fail my exam like a champion. It inspires confidence for people who need it. Have a multiple choice test and the numbers aren't adding up? Say no more, hit the squiggly equal sign and you'll find a value that you can round up to something vaguely similar on your selection of choices. I shook it three times like a magic eight ball, hoping for some help on problems and I swear it told me engineering degrees are overrated. I now keep it on me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Marvi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator, but protect it with the included shield to keep screen from cracking.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice calculator at a super nice price. My only quibble: the screen is fragile. If this is for your teen student, make sure she/he puts the plastic cover over it; otherwise, the screen likely will crack while transported in a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Nishi

customer_reviews.title: This is a engineering requirement.
customer_reviews.text: I'm studying engineering and this calculator is my savior. It has constants, conversions, functions, solvers, and just about everything else you can think of. And it is approved by Texas state board for examinations. Forget all those highshool teachers who say you need a $200 graphing calculator (Because colleges won't let you use them anyway) and get this thing. I own three because, well, I won't pass a timed test without it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: The best calculator for this price range
customer_reviews.text: The best calculator for this price range. It has everything I could possibly want from a calculator as an engineering student. Graphing is generally useless in higher math classes and you will find yourself using computer software for complicated functions anyway. Useful tools this calculator has: Matrix operations Vector calculations Cross and Dot products Derivatives and Integrals (Definate only, it will not determine the functions for you) System of equation solver Unit conversion A database of useful scientific Constants (Plancks constant, Gravity, etc) Easily converts and combines complex fractions with one keystroke AND uses real fraction notation. Easy key layout. What else could you need?
customer_reviews.author: N. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Does a lot for what it costs. Keys are crisp and snappy. The screen is clearly visible. The cover is effectively a case and the weight is gossamer light. Arrives in clamshell package with a manual. Assembled in the Philippines.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and inexpensive calculator
customer_reviews.text: As a student in Mechanical Engineering Technology I've used it for every math, physics and engineering class I've ever had. I'm very happy with it and I'm distraught when I misplace it. Things I find useful with it - every operation I needed was accessed in a few strokes, the conversions and constants libraries saved me on a few test questions where I otherwise would've got a question wrong, commands that use variables like x^y or fractions are held little boxes making equations look much neater and readable. There's no graphing capability but graphing calculators I saw costed much more.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect calculator for High School through College!
customer_reviews.text: My friend’s daughter needed this for school. It is the same model they lend at school for a ridiculous price. Buying it outright is much more practical. These Texas Instruments calculators last for years - I know as I’ve had a similar one from my college days and it still works fine after all these years.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: buy it its so advanced
customer_reviews.text: this is an amazing calculator; watch the videos online its just insane what you can do with this and at the price this does everything but graphing and more. Very happy use it with advanced trig and algebra its a definite buy
customer_reviews.author: J. Savage

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best non-graphing calculator.
customer_reviews.text: The capabilities of this calculator rivals that of graphing calculators. I got this specifically for the FE exam and have zero regrets. It certain took some time to get comfortable with it and I feel like I find new functions every day that surprise me. This is as good as it gets without a graphing function.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Superb calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is excellent. It has all mathematical functions needed for an engineer, and it is really reliable. I used HP before this one, but this is, in my opinion, as good as HP if not better. The only cons is that when you try to see what is the value of, for example, square root of 5 it will not give you the value as a decimal number but will just return square root of 5. Other than that, this calculator will serve its purpose for many years I believe and it comes with batteries that are standard, not those special kinds that I really do not like
customer_reviews.author: Uros

customer_reviews.title: It's  the best. Buy it. Now. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: IT GIVES ANSWERS IN EXACT FORMMMMMMMMMMM YES!!!!!!!!!!! NO LONGER SHALL I HAVE TO REMEMBER THE UNIT CIRCLE!!!! I've had this calculator (not from this seller) but its so good for school. I like the double tap feature. Some buttons you can tap more than once to navigate without having to hit second. This helps you get through the calculator work fast. I like how you can store variables extremely easy. I also like that it has everything i ever needed for calculus, statistics, and physics. way better than the ti84.
customer_reviews.author: mparch

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: Love this calculator! The instruction booklet is throrough and easy to skim through. I was worried when deciding on this purchase because plenty of people said the buttons were hard to read? The buttons are fine and I love the large 4 line screen.
customer_reviews.author: Xochitl Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Because this calculator can reduce fractions, it wasn’t allowed on tests. Also. and most importantly, the arrows buttons stopped working within 2 months of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: 10 digit display limit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator. I bought it for my studies in environmental engineering, but unfortunately it won't cut it because it has a 10 digit display limit. For example: Converting from seconds to milliseconds: 556.2 x 10^(-12) x (10^3) returns a value of 0.000000556, dropping the 2. Of course one could infer that the remaining digit has been dropped and can add that to their final answer of 5.562x10^(-7), but in the event of a timed and scored quiz/exam this is not an ideal situation to find oneself in. For this reason alone I urge caution before purchasing this calculator for upper level courses.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator hands down.
customer_reviews.text: The BEST calculators an engineer can have starting collage (and even high school). It is such a powerful tool that will help you in anything from calculus to chemistry. It does integrals and and derivatives also which is a huge plus. And the polynomial solver is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Shan Rustam

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Professional Engineer's Exam
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and is easy to use after watching a couple youtube videos or reading the manual for certain quadratic equation or matrices. Can't decide whether TI or this is better. I think that it is a draw! Side-note: Will these calculators ever drop in price? Been the same for decades...
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Needed a new calculator for the FE exam
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I have an old TI-30Xs and love it, the TI-36X is just an upgrade. In all, loved the functions and used it for the Fundamentals of Engineering exam. Passed the exam so I will drop a 5 star :).
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: This Calculator is amazing. I am a Senior Engineering Student and this ...
customer_reviews.text: This Calculator is amazing. I am a Senior Engineering Student and this calculator got me through all my Maths (all Calc classes and Differential Equations) and through my all science classes (Physics, Thermo, and Chem). The matrix functions are the best you can solve 3x3 matrices or 4x4. This also allows you to solve functions and for up to 3 unknown values (a,b, and c). Lastly, it can't graph but it gives you table so you can draw graphs on your own. This function was very helpful in Calc 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good if you like ti calculators
customer_reviews.text: Good if you like ti calculators. Bounds better than the Casio. Suffers from the same problem as every ti calculator: having to navigate endless menus to perform the same calculations that an hp could do in a few button presses.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome calculator
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! For a non graphing calculator it is the best in the market. It does get the integral answer, but depending on the calculation it crashs due to the massive calculation needed. This calculator does not give you the simbolic form, it gives you the numeric answer. Only if you include the Pi in the calculation, it gives you the answer with the Pi symbol. No regrets and helped a lot on my calculus 1 and 2 classes.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Functional, Lightweight, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these calculators a year ago while I was preparing for the FE exam. I really grew to love it, and have since purchased a second one to keep in my desk at work. They small, lightweight, and have a lot of great functions. I have yet to experience issues with either of mine and I use them daily.
customer_reviews.author: yb

customer_reviews.title: It'll do
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my College Algebra class and it did what it is supposed to. It took me a bit to fully work it or understand some of its functions, but only because I am a little older and the young know it all's in my class showed me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Castro

customer_reviews.title: great calc
customer_reviews.text: this calculator is all i needed for an intro chemistry class. it has the log function and the ee button. it also has the exponent button. it does more than that, but i did not end up using more than that and the basic multiplication and division.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Short

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments TI-36X Pro Engineering/Scientific Calculator
product_meta.description:
Advanced, four-line scientific calculator, with higher-level math and science functionality, that is ideal for computer science and engineering courses in which graphing technology may not be permitted.

AMAZON.COM
Ideal for students at every level, from junior high school algebra to college calculus, the Texas Instruments TI36 packs a lot of punch in a small, inexpensive unit. This solar-powered calculator combines features for statistical analysis, Boolean logic operations, and unit conversions in one sleek package.

Math students will appreciate TI36X's ability to perform fractional equations and calculate angle units (radians, grads, degrees) when performing trigonometric functions. Everyone will find the calculator's English/metric conversions helpful.

The TI36Xs single-line LCD is a little difficult to read when the unit is lying on a desk, and users in need of graphing functions will have to look elsewhere. Overall, however, for a calculator in this price range, the TI36X provides enough power for most high-level math and science needs.
feature_bullets: Ideal for curricula in which graphing technology may not be permitted.
MultiView display shows multiple calculations at the same time on screen.
MathPrint shows math expressions, symbols and stacked fractions as they appear in textbooks
Ideal for high school through college: Algebra 1 & 2, Geometry, Trigonometry, Statistics, Calculus, Biology, etc.
Convert fractions, decimals and terms including Pi into alternate representations.
Select degrees/radians, floating/fix, number format modes.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars6,517 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
